      • getSigner

        public final ValueReference getSigner()
        Return the identifier for signing entity (unverified until verifySignature() is called).

      • verifySignature

        public final boolean verifySignature(java.security.PublicKey pubkey)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns true if the metadata signature has been signed by the given key. Note that this alone does not ensure that the handle values are valid - you must also call verifyValue() on each handle value to determine if the signature for that specific value is valid. This allows for the possibility of partial signatures and unsigned values in a handle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • verifyValue

        public final boolean verifyValue(HandleValue value)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Return true if the given value was properly signed. Note that this does not ensure that the signer is trusted. That should be done by the calling code using the getSigner()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
